citations.narrative:
Mr. DeGasperi and Ms.Pursely were both observed jointly exhibiting animals without a valid USDA license at a public
event in New Philadelphia, Ohio. Additionally, both have conducted regulated dealer activity without a license by
consigning covered species to the Mount Hope exotics auction. The exhibition being performed at this event included
selling food to the public to feed the animals and allowing public interaction with exhibit animals. The two unlicensed
individuals were both running and working the animal exhibition area. The animals currently being exhibited are one
African Crested Porcupine, one Mountain Coati, two Dromedary Camels, one Brama, one Sheep, six Pigs, and 26 goats.
Auction records indicate that Mr. Degasperi sold one African Crested Porcupine at the Mount Hope exotics sale under the
fraudulent USDA license number 54-C-0044 on 16-August-2022. Auction records also indicate that Ms.Pursely sold two
African crested porcupines under the fraudulent license number 44-C-0044 on 03-November-2022. Both sales records
listed the same address for the consignment. Neither of these license numbers is a valid license.
Mr. DeGasperi and Ms.Pursely stated to an non-uniformed inspector during the exhibition event on 01-July-2023 that they
were licensed. The inspector then attempted to locate license number of the individuals and determined they were not
licensed. Upon the return of the inspector in uniform, the individuals stated that they will be applying for a USDA license
once their moving process is completed but they are not currently licensed. Operating without a valid license impedes the
ability of APHIS officials to ensure adequate welfare for the animals in the facility. No person shall operate as a dealer,
exhibitor, or operator of an auction sale, without a valid license.
No regulated activity, to include the exhibition or sale of regulated animals, can be conducted until a USDA license has
been obtained.

On 03-November-2022 Ms.Persely sold two African Crested Porcupines and one Flemish Giant Rabbit at the Mount Hope
exotics sale under the fraudulent license number 44-C-0044. On 16-September-2022 Mr.DeGasperi sold one African
Crested Porcupine at the Mount Hope exotics sale under the fraudulent USDA license number 54-C-0044. The license
numbers that both individuals used on sales records are not associated with either unlicensed individual or active USDA
license numbers. The addresses used on both sale records indicate that both individuals are working out of the same
location. An active license is required to sell animals at an auction.
Falsification of certificate numbers to conduct regulated activity without a USDA license interferes with APHIS officials’
ability to ensure the Animal Welfare Act regulations are being followed and that adequate animal welfare is maintained.
Correct by ensuring that all information provided to APHIS officials through APHIS forms and other means are valid.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representatives.
